00020 #ifndef _UTIL_GUID_H_
00021 #define _UTIL_GUID_H_

00023 /// @file Guid.h This file provides functions for creating globally unique identifiers.
00024 
00025 //
00026 #include "portability/apt-win-dll.h"
00027 //
00028 #include <cstring>
00029 #include <list>
00030 #include <string>
00031 
00032 ///
00033 /// RFC4122 v4  Guid => 09fdee5a-b19e-4101-0668-0840519ad701
00034 /// Classic APT Guid => 0000007361-1232759575-1336980168-0774759233-0407464966
00035 ///
00036 /// The format of the guids affxutil::GenerateNewGuid() will make.
00037 /// Comment it out for the old format.
00038 #define AFFY_GUID_FORMAT_RFC4122 1
00039 
00040 /// The env var to read the seed to srand from on unix.
00041 /// This is handy for debugging.
00042 #define AFFY_DEBUG_SRAND_SEED_ENVVAR "APT_DEBUG_SRAND_SEED"
00043 
00044 
00045 namespace affxutil
00046 {
00047   /// @brief     Ensure that srand has been seeded.
00048   ///            Safe to call multiple times.
00049   void ensure_srand_seeded();
00050   
00051   /// @brief     Seed srand with data from the system env
00052   ///            Or from 'APT_DEBUG_SRAND_SEED' on unix.
00053   ///            It will always set the srand seed when called.
00054   void affy_seed_srand();
00055 
00056 /*! The GUID type */
00057 typedef std::string GuidType;
00058 
00059 /*! An STL list of guid types */
00060 typedef std::list<GuidType> GuidTypeList;
00061 
00062 /*! This class provides functions for creating globally unique identifiers. */
00063 /// @todo: Why do we need GuidType and this class?
00064 class APTLIB_API Guid
00065 {
00066 public:
00067         /*! Constructor */
00068         Guid();
00069 
00070         /*! Destructor */
00071         ~Guid();
00072 
00073         /*! Generates a new GUID.
00074          *
00075          * @return The new GUID.
00076          */
00077         static GuidType GenerateNewGuid();
00078 };

00080 };
